description.narrative: 1. Increased integration of early early recovery into the humanitarian response. 2. Advises and support for linking relief to development provided 3. Development of a Durable Solutions Strategy for IDPs and returnees facilitated and supported.

comment.narrative: Sudan experiences a complex protracted emergency with different parts of the country facing various needs, each of them requiring different levels of response and adequate approaches. Whilst the lingering humanitarian crises bring relief-focused needs that still demand short-term support, the patterns of assistance need to evolve as opportunities permit and a momentum has been created.
1. INTEGRATING EARLY RECOVERY INTO THE HUMANITARIAN RESPONSE 2. LINKING RELIEF AND DEVELOPMENT 3. Durable Solutions Strategy for IDPs and returnees is developed and implementation started

1. Early recovery has been increasingly integrated into the humanitarian response 2. Humanitarian Country Team (HCT) agreement to develop a Multi-Year Humanitarian Strategy (MYHS) 3. Agreement in HCT-UNCT to develop context specific durable solutions strategies
1. INTEGRATING EARLY RECOVERY INTO THE HUMANITARIAN RESPONSE 2. LINKING RELIEF AND DEVELOPMENT 3. Durable Solutions Strategy for IDPs and returnees is developed and implementation started

1. Early recovery has been increasingly integrated into the humanitarian response 2:Humanitarian Country Team (HCT) agreement to develop a Multi-Year Humanitarian Strategy (MYHS) • Enhanced collaboration between Inter-Sector Coordination Group and UNDAF Results Groups 3. Agreement in HCT-UNCT to develop context specific durable solutions strategies • Agreement amongst all relevant stakeholders, including the government, on developing joint methodologies for IDP profiling, intention surveys, and data collection to inform durable solutions • Joint IDP Profiling Service (JIPS) missions to Sudan (one with the Workd Bank) • Proposal successfully submitted to UN-WB Partnership Trust Fund to enhance HDP Nexus (data collection to inform Durable Solutions programming and piloting)

Regular update on security situation, associated risks and recommended mitigating measures enable INGOs/IOs for safe delivery of their humanitarian programme activities. 732 situation report produced ans shared.
The project target 768 situation reports to be produced and shared.

600 situation report produced ans shared.The UNDSS and INGO/IOs continued sharing relevant security information during the reporting report. Although the information was largely collected, analysed and shared by the UNDSS, contribution of INGO for collection, analysis and sharing for information was very much significant for deep field location, where UN has no or limited presence.

comment.narrative: NA
Conduct 10 Security Risk Assessments in all the Areas of Responsibility (AOR) especially in Protocol areas.
4 Security Risk Assessment conducted in Blue Nile, Kassala, South Kordofan and West Kordofan states
Conduct 10 Security Risk Assessments in all the Areas of Responsibility (AOR) especially in Protocol areas.

During the reporting period UNDSS moved from the old Security Risk Management (SRA) towards the new SRM, which is a more comprehensive and complete document describing the security situation and measures to be taken to mitigate the risk. There were 7 SRMs conducted throughout the country (except Darfur and Abyei) in addition to some 8 missions completed in the mentioned areas.

comment.narrative: 1. Low capacity of Justice institutions, 2. In 2012 Public Perception Survey, 47.3% High Confidence, 27.4% Medium Confidence, 16% Low Confidence 3. One Criminal Justice Forums established in North Darfur States in Darfur 4. in 2016, 350 Prison Officers trained on human rights and prison Management
Has not initiated activities during this period.
N/A

1. Medium capacity of justice institutions 2. 50% high confidence in justice Institutions 3. 4 Criminal Justice Forums to be establish in 4 States in Darfur 4. to support and establish 5 Justice and Confidence Centers in Darfur 5. To support the establishment and operation of 15 local legal aid networks in 3 Darfur states

1. Medium capacity of justice institutions result is on track 2. On track. the percentage of confidence in justice Institution will be measured by early 2018. 3. 4 Criminal Justice Forums are established in 4 States in Darfur 4. 5 Justice and Confidence Centers are supported and established in Darfur 5. 14 local legal aid networks are support and established to operate in 3 Darfur states

comment.narrative: This project has been established in line with UNDP’s role as Managing Agent of the Sudan Humanitarian Fund

This project has been established in line with UNDP’s role as Managing Agent of the Sudan Humanitarian Fund. The project serves to manage the contracts related to allocations to NGOs through a proposal review and selection process managed by OCHA as the SHF Fund Manager. For 2017 allocation Jan-Dec 2017 of the SHF, a total amount of US 23,730,334 was allocated to NGOs.

comment.narrative: This project has been established in line with UNDP’s role as Managing Agent of the Sudan Humanitarian Fund.

This project has been established in line with UNDP’s role as Managing Agent of the Sudan Humanitarian Fund. The project serves to manage the contracts related to allocations to NGOs through a proposal review and selection process managed by OCHA as the SHF Fund Manager. For 2017 allocation Jan-Dec 2017 of the SHF, a total amount of US$23,730,334 was allocated to NGOs.
For 2017 allocation Jan-Dec 2017 of the SHF, a total amount of US$23,730,334 was allocated to NGOs, allocated by sector as follows; in the FOOD SECURITY AND LIVELIHOODS cluster was USD $2898440.03

title.narrative: Enhancing Conducive Environment for Returnees and Host

description.narrative: Enhancing Conducive Environment for Returnees and Host Community Members in Um Dukhum in the Central Darfur State, Sudan

Integrated early recovery intervention to improve conducive environment for Sustainable Return and Reintegration of IDPs and Refugees the 3 communities (Garaya, Beltibei and Magan) in the Um Dukhum Locality in the Central Darfur State, Sudan.
administrative division
capital of a political entity
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

1.1. Number of peacebuilding and community reconciliation efforts undertaken to promote a conducive environment for return and reintegration (HRP 2016). 1.2. Number of functional community-based protection networks/structures supported (CPC, CFS, women centres/safe spaces, mine action committees) 1.3. Number of girls, boys, women and men receiving individual or community-based psychosocial support and services (HRP 2016). 1.4. Number of people reached through protection awareness-raising interventions (by age and gender) (HRP 2016). 1.5. Number of community infrastructure established 1.6. Number of women, boys, girls and men benefiting from livelihood and recreational activities

comment.narrative: Baseline: 1.1. zero 1.2. zero 1.3. zero 1.4. zero 1.5. Zero (0) community infrastructure established 1.6. Zero (0) women, boys, girls and men benefiting from livelihood and recreational activities

Targets (year 1) 1.1. 5 peace-building and community reconciliation efforts 1.2. 3 functional community-based protection networks/structures supported 1.3. 700 girls, boys, women and men receiving individual or community-based psychosocial support and services 1.4. 5,000 people reached through protection awareness-raising interventions (50% male) 1.5. 3 community infrastructure established 1.6. 900 women, boys, girls and men benefiting from livelihood and recreational activities

Expected Result: Socioeconomic self reliance and resilience of vulnerable returnees, IDPs and other host communities' members improved. 1.1. 5 peace-building and community reconciliation efforts 1.2. 3 functional community-based protection networks/structures supported 1.3. 6000 girls, boys, women and men receiving individual or community-based psychosocial support and services 1.4. 4,500 people reached through protection awareness-raising interventions (50% male) 1.5. 3 community infrastructure established 1.6. 9,500 women, boys, girls and men benefiting from livelihood and recreational activities
